form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: Part 7. Consideration for Providing Affidavit of Support ( (Continued)

full_text: Screened by NARA, 9/14/2023 Part 7. I agree to provide to the sponsored immigrant(s) whatever financial support is the sponsored immigrant(s) at an income that is at least 125 percent of the Federal poverty guidelines necessary (or 100 tc immigrant(s) Public receive(s) any Federal means-tested public benefit (other than the benefits specified in section 423(d) of percent for petitioners on active duty in the U.S. Armed Forces sponsoring a spouse or child). If the sponsored Law 104-193) while my support obligation continues in force, I agree to reimburse the Federal, State, or local agency for the costs of the means-tested public benefit provided to the sponsored immigrant(s). This support obligation shall continue in force with respect to each sponsored immigrant identified in Part 3 until each sponsored immigrant becomes a citizen of the United States; has worked, or can be credited with, 40 qualifying quarters under title II of the Social Security Act; ceases to hold the status of an alien lawfully admitted for permanent residence and leaves the United States; or dies. 2. Notice of Change of Address. Until my obligation under this affidavit of support terminates. I shall give written notice of any change in my address, in the manner prescribed by INS regulations, to the Immigration and Naturalization Service that has jurisdiction over the place of residence of the sponsored immigrant(s), and to the State in which the sponsored immigrant(s) reside(s). I shall give this notice within 30 days of the change in my address. I understand that failure to give this notice may subject me to the civil penalty established under section 213A(d)(2) of the Act. Civil Action to Enforce. If, before the obligations under this affidavit of support expire, the immigrant on whose behalf this affidavit of support is executed receives any Federal or State means-tested public benefits, other than those public benefits specified in section 423(d) of Public Law 104-193, the Federal, State or local agency that provides the public benefit may reimbursement from the sponsor of this affidavit. If you fail to honor the request for reimbursement, the Federal, State or request local agency may sue the sponsor in any United States District Court or in any State court with jurisdiction of civil actions for breach of contract. INS will provide information on the names and addresses of sponsors to benefit-providing agencies. The sponsor may also be liable for the costs of collection, including legal fees. I acknowledge that section 213A(a)(1)(B) of the Act grants standing to bring a civil action to enforce this affidavit o: support to: (1) The sponsored immigrant(s); (2) The Government of the United States; and, any State or political subdivision that provides means-tested public benefits to the sponsored immigrant(s), and any private entity that administers any Federal, State or local means-tested public benefit program and that provides any public benefit to the sponsored immigrant(s).
